page.title: 04DAIRYING
page.content: Three farms in the area are dairy farms as well as keeping beef cattle and sheep.The average size of dairy herd is 95 milking cows.They are milked twice a day, at 6.30 in the morning and again at 5.45 in the evening.The dairy farms are the ones with better pasture, generally the lower land in the valleys and they tend to have been improved by draining and re-seeding.As with beef cattle, the cows are kept in shelter in Winter and fed on silage gathered in late June and July .Each of the farms has a milking parlour, again quite recently installed.The milk produced is collected each day by a tanker lorry from the refrigerated tanks on the farms and taken to the dairy in Carlisle.The main cow breeds are Friesian and Ayrshire.
